page.title: 14Long Edge Destroyed!
page.content: 'Long Edge Bulldozing a Devastating Loss' That was the title of the Congleton Chronicle on Friday 17th May 1985.A large part of the woodland at Long Edge ,which links Biddulph Park with Cloud End,was destroyed by the owner. It is believed that many forms of wildlife existed there including at least one species of rare butterfly. 'It is a total destruction of very decreasing wildlife.Basically it is vandalism,'said a spokesman. A bulldozer was used to uproot all the vegetation.Roots,branches and trunks were burned.All the stone was removed,some of it being massive boulders of millstone grit.The land amounting to several acres was graded and sown with grass seed. It is now a green field to be used for grazing.
